multiple.question: In which of the following periods was the transcontinental railroad completed?
In which century did African American slavery become the dominant source of labor in the American South?
In which of the following periods was the cotton gin invented?

hotspots.hotspot:
THE EVENT

The writing of the Declaration of Independence.

WHEN?

When did the event occur? The Declaration of Independence was written during the summer of 1776, between June 11 and July 1. Previous events include: The Boston Tea Party, 1773; the passage of the Intolerable Acts, 1774; fighting at Lexington and Concord, April 1775; and Olive Branch Petition rejected, August 1775.

WHAT?

What was the situation or condition during the event? Jefferson, Adams, and many other Revolutionary-era leaders were influenced by Enlightenment ideas, such as the natural rights of man. The founders also had economic reasons to declare independence, as the British had increased taxation and restricted settlement. Politically, all three men in this painting could be considered treasonous British subjects.

WHERE?

Where did the event occur? Thomas Jefferson wrote his first draft of the Declaration of Independence in rooms rented from bricklayer Joseph Graff on the outskirts of Philadelphia. Jefferson rented two rooms from Graff, a small bedroom and a sitting room.

WHO?

Who was involved? The Continental Congress appointed five committee members from a geographic range of colonies (Massachusetts, Connecticut, New York, Pennsylvania, and Virginia). John Adams, from Massachusetts, urged the Virginian Thomas Jefferson to take the lead and draft the document justifying independence.

content.text:
Using Memory Devices for Several Events within a Period

The Cold War Begins

  • Truman Doctrine: pledged United States support for any country struggling against communism (1947)
  • Marshall Plan: gave billions of U.S. dollars to western European nations to help them recover financially from World War II (1947)
  • The Berlin Crisis threatened World War III between the United States and Soviet Union (1948–49). After the U.S. ordered an airlift to help West Berlin, Soviet Premier Joseph Stalin backed down.
  • NATO was created by the United States and its allies for collective security in western Europe against potential Soviet aggression (1949).
  • "Red Scare": reflected American fears of communist subversion within the United States and communist expansion worldwide
  • China become a communist country in 1949.
  • Atomic bomb was successfully tested by the Soviets in 1949.
  • Korean War brought the United States into war with communist North Korean and Chinese troops who were supported by the Soviet Union (1950–53).

multiple.question: Which event was MOST likely the immediate cause for the formation of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO)?

answers.answer: Soviet detonation of an atomic bomb

multiple.question: Which two events in 1949 demonstrated the limits of U.S. power during the Cold War?

answers.answer: Communist control of China and Soviet detonation of an atomic bomb
The Marshall Plan and the Korean War
Soviet detonation of an atomic bomb and the Marshall Plan
The Korean War and the Truman Doctrine
The Marshall Plan and the formation of NATO

content.text:
One of the prerequisites for industrialization is an efficient system for transporting raw materials to factories and finished goods to markets. The United States had no such system in the early years of the republic. But work was under way that would ultimately remove the transportation obstacle.

There were several ways to solve the problem of the small American markets. One was to look for customers overseas, and American merchants continued their efforts to do that. Among the first acts of the new Congress when it met in 1789 were two tariff bills giving preference to American ships in American ports, helping to stimulate an expansion of domestic shipping.

More important—indeed the principal reason for the growth of American trade in this period—was the outbreak of war in Europe in the 1790s, allowing Yankee merchant vessels to take over most of the carrying trade between Europe and the Western Hemisphere.

As early as 1793, the young republic had a merchant marine and a foreign trade larger than those of any country except England. In proportion to its population, the United States had more ships and international commerce than any country in the world. Between 1789 and 1810, the total tonnage of American vessels engaged in overseas traffic rose from less than 125,000 to nearly one million. American ships had carried only 30 percent of the country's exports in 1789; they were carrying over 90 percent in 1810. The figures for American ships carrying imports increased even more dramatically, from 17.5 percent to 90 percent in the same period.

From AMERICAN HISTORY: CONNECTING WITH THE PAST, 14th Edition, by Alan Brinkley, copyright © 2012 The McGraw-Hill Companies, Inc.

multiple.question: Which men served as President of the United States between 1789 and 1810?

answers.answer: Washington, John Adams, Jefferson, and Madison
Jefferson, Madison, Monroe, and John Quincy Adams

multiple.question: What time periods were covered in this excerpt?

answers.answer: "Religion, Reform, and Renaissance in Antebellum America" and "Territorial Expansion and Manifest Destiny"
"The Early Republic" and the "Transformation of the Economy and Society in Antebellum America"

multiple.question: Timelines are the only way to remember events in chronological order.
A memory device created by someone else is a better tool than one you create yourself.
Knowing periodization is very helpful when answering essay questions on the AP U.S. History exam.
It's not important to learn the dates that all presidents served, just the most important ones.
The questions in this quiz were presented in the same order that you learned the tools to help you organize information chronologically.
